meta.description: Autism Speaks will host the CDC’s Georgina Peacock, M.D., and the presidents of the Autism Society of America and Autism Science Foundation for a webinar about COVID vaccines and autism.

title: , CDC and partners host COVID vaccine webinar for the autism community
cleaned_text:
On Wednesday, Jan. 27, at 4 p.m. ET, Autism Speaks will host the CDC’s Georgina Peacock, M.D., and the presidents of the Autism Society of America and Autism Science Foundation for a webinar about COVID vaccines and autism.

This panel discussion, moderated by Stuart Spielman, senior vice president of advocacy for Autism Speaks, will offer information about the impact of COVID on the autism community, why vaccines are important for protecting autistic people and where to find information about your state’s rollout plan.

Registration is limited, but a recording of the webinar will be made available on Autism Speaks YouTube channel following the event for anyone unable to attend the live event.

The public is welcome to email questions to advocacy@autismspeaks.org in advance of the webinar, and live attendees can submit questions via chat. Any questions we receive that we do not have time address during the live event will be answered in follow-up communications after the webinar.
